page.title: 13 ST.JOHN'S CHURCH
page.content: St John's was founded about the year 1140 originally as a hospital, although a small chapel has always been there. It is one of the oldest churches in Northampton. St. John's is situated at the bottom of Bridge Street at the southern end of the town. It is a very good example of golden ironstone being remodelled in the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries. St. Johns was a hospital in medieval times. It then became an alms-house. In 1880 it was sold to the Catholics who made the house into a church and altered it for worship. St.Johns is the only remaining medieval part of the hospital of St. Johns. As a hospital it consisted of two storeys. Monks lived on the second floor in their cells.
